bibl.title: Photograph of Russell Haden presenting a gavel made from wood taken from Walter Reed's birthplace to Paul G. Streit, Walter Reed Army Medical Center, September 19, 1951

div1.head: Photograph of Russell Haden presenting a gavel made from wood taken from Walter Reed's birthplace to Paul G. Streit, Walter Reed Army Medical Center, September 19, 1951
div1.p: WALTER REED ARMY MEDICAL CENTER, Washington, D.C., September 19, 1951

Gavel made from timber taken from Belroi, Virginia birthplace home of Major Walter
Reed is presented to Walter Reed Army Medical Center, so named September 13, 1951
on the 100th anniversary of Major Reed's birth. Standing under the bust of Major
Reed is Dr. Russell Haden, Crozet, Virginia physician, former Cleveland (Ohio)
Clinic staff member and now head of the American Red Cross blood program who pre-
sented the gavel to Major General Paul H. Streit (left) commanding general of
Walter Reed Army Medical Center, while Colonel Paul Fancher, chief of the hospital's
Medical Service, witnesses the presentation. Formerly owned by Dr. Clarence Porter
Jones of Newport News, Virginia, the gavel was presented by him to Dr. Haden, whose
hobby is gavel collecting. Upon learning of the name change of Army Medical Center
to its new designation, Dr. Haden presented the gavel to the Center.
